info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:18PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm wind gusts will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, eastern Teton and northwestern Cascade Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 616 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Choteau to 10 miles northwest of Cascade. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph will advance well east of the thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Choteau, Fairfield, Dutton, Fort Shaw, Fort Shaw, Power, Collins, Farmington, Vaughn, Simms, Sun River and Pishkun Reservoir. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 290 and 323. Highway 200 between mile markers 118 and 139. Highway 287 between mile markers 47 and 64. Highway 89 between mile markers 9 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
